title.narrative: The Third Water Supply and Sanitation for Low Income Communities (PAMSIMAS)

description.narrative: The Third Water Supply and Sanitation for Low Income Communities (PAMSIMAS) is a Government of Indonesia (GOI) program funded partially by the World Bank (WB) and co-financed by Government of Australia (GOA). PAMSIMAS aims to increase the number of rural and peri urban communities in 4,000 villages access to improved water supply and public sanitation facilities and better hygiene behaviour practices. The project is a GoI key program in the water and sanitation sector to achieve the Millennium Development Goal (MDG) target in halving the population without access to safe water supply and basic sanitation by 2015. GOA's support helps with: technical assistance; capacity building; socialisation; investment grants to communities to construct water supply and public sanitation in approximately 800 villages; training for up to 200 community facilitators; selection, recruitment and training of a cadre of central trainers; provision of technical experts in hygiene improvement; and a behavio
